ygData.subject: Re: Fine tuning/decreasing lag (was: Ok, Complaint time!)
ygData.msgSnippet: Speaking of connection problems. EVERYTIME I log into EQ for the first time of a gaming session, I lose connection after about 5 minutes of play.    I have to
ygData.messageBody:
Speaking of connection problems.
EVERYTIME I log into EQ for the first time of a gaming session, I lose
connection after about 5 minutes of play. I have to log off my ISP
reconnect and load back up EQ then I'm fine for the rest of the time.

ANYONE have any idea why this may be happening? It seems to me like more
of an ISP problem since I have to log off of my isp to reconnect to EQ but
who knows...


On Mon, 27 Sep 1999, Knight wrote:

> From: Knight <knight@...>
>
> Hail,
>
> Here's a quick checklist of items that might cause intermittent lag
> and slowdowns:
>
> 1. Disable virus checking software
> 2. Disable MS Fastfind
> 3. Disable ICQ
> 4. Disable Windows 98 automatic Update
> 5. Disable AOL messenger
> 6. Disable PointCast network
> 7. Close Mail/News readers
> 8. Disable System board polling (ie temperature, fan, monitors)
> 9. Defrag drive with EQ
> 10.verify there is enough room on drive (including root drive for swap).
> 11. Disable Task Scheduler
> 12. Disable Web/FTP servers on the machine you are using (you'll be surprised
> how many ppl run an ftp server on their eq box and complain about lag =P)
> 13. Can you see the pattern yet? =)
>
> Basically, if you can time the lag intervals pretty acurately, then it
> is possible its comming from your end.
>
> My ritual is:
> reboot computer
> disable, close all internet/system tasks
> run EQ
>
> Just my input,
> //Aldaren
>
> >
